description: From Middle English forjugen; in sense 1, from Old French fourjugier (“to judge illegally, dispossess”); in sense 2, from Middle English for- + jugen (“to judge”), equivalent to for- +‎ judge. Compare fordeem.

verbs.description: forjudge (third-person singular simple present forjudges, present participle forjudging, simple past and past participle forjudged)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete except as a legal term) To exclude, oust, or dispossess by a judgment; prohibit (from).
(transitive, dialectal in Britain) To condemn judicially (to a penalty).
